intro: Dalechampia brasiliensis var. genuina, commonly known as the Brazilian chuchuhuasi, is a species native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its palmate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a milky latex sap, which has been traditionally used in folk medicine. Its growth habit includes climbing or trailing stems, often found in humid, shaded environments. The botanical features of this plant make it an important component of the rainforest ecosystem.
